Title.evidence: The UK Medical Research Council ST03 trial compared perioperative epirubicin, cisplatin and capecitabine (ECX) chemotherapy with or without bevacizumab (B) in gastric and oesophagogastric junctional cancer.

Trial_Design.evidence: Of 1063 patients randomized, 895 (84·2 per cent) underwent resection; surgical details were available for 880 (98·3 per cent).

Intervention.evidence: The UK Medical Research Council ST03 trial compared perioperative epirubicin, cisplatin and capecitabine (ECX) chemotherapy with or without bevacizumab (B) in gastric and oesophagogastric junctional cancer.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 1063 patients randomized, 895 (84·2 per cent) underwent resection; surgical details were available for 880 (98·3 per cent).

Number_Analysed.evidence: Postoperative assessment data were available for 873 patients; complications occurred in 458 (52·5 per cent) overall.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No difference in survival was noted between the arms of the trial.

Harms.evidence: Complications occurred in 458 (52·5 per cent) overall, of whom 71 (8·1 per cent) developed complications deemed to be life‐threatening by the responsible clinician.
